problems.title: Maximum Number of Visible Points (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
You are given an array points, an integer angle, and your location.
Return the maximum number of points you can see.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and angle.
Second line: two integers posx, posy (your location).
Next n lines: two integers xi, yi.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the maximum number of visible points.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3 90
1 1
2 1
2 2
3 3

Sample Output
3

Explanation: All points can be made visible.
hintsList: Convert all coordinates to angles relative to your location using atan2.
Sort the angles and use a sliding window of size 'angle'.
Handle the circular nature by duplicating angles + 360.
